entry.title: A little glance at S/4 Hana OUTPUT MANAGEMENT and compare its to our old friend NAST
entry.content:
As we already know, NAST output has been used over time, from ECC to S4/HANA, due to its reliability and its customization. Based on NAST, we could generate tons of outputs with different types, from simple PDF form or Adobe form to more complex output like EDI/IDOC or even XML.

However, Output management is introduced in S/4 HANA as S/4 HANA OUTPUT MANAGEMENT, as more “centralized” approach to output, based on BRF+ (business rule framework). FYI, BRF+ has been on SAP from ECC, which supported users specific customizations, based on the role, but applying this for S/4 HANA output management is new thing. Using S/4 HANA Output Management is a less-coding approach, compares to NAST, when you need to do bunches of customizations, which is prefer for consultants than end users.

For short, you can check out this table from our friend :

S/4HANA Output Management vs. NAST: When to Choose... - SAP Community

 

Technology

BRF+

SAPscript / Smart Forms

Customization Flexibility

Limited by service nodes

Customizable to your heart’s content

Form Type

Adobe Forms

SAPscript, Smart Forms

Output Types

Print, Email, XML, EDI

Print, Email, Fax, EDI

Multiple Outputs per Document

BRF+ (but expect headaches)

Easier management with condition records

Learning Curve

Steep—better grab some coffee 

Familiar, like catching up with an old friend

Centralized Management

Yes—streamlined oversight

Traditional, less streamlined

Future-Proofing

Yes—leverages the latest technology

No—legacy technology means potential obsolescence

Recommended Use Case

Standard scenarios, new systems

Custom-heavy projects, legacy systems

For short, we can understand that, using NAST is like our reliable, multi functional car that can ramp up anything, just look not really good, but Output Management is introduced as sport cars, like a F1 Mercedes AMG W16, that could only drive on an F1 track.

The purpose of this blog is not to deep dive on theoretical questions how better or how worse of each method, but to know how the configuration of output management, is it much easier than a NAST approach?

Let I guide you steps by steps

HOW SETUP OF OUTPUT MANAGEMENT

To check out our Output Management,  lets come to our SPRO -> Cross-Application Components -> Output Control

As we can see, there are bunches of configurations, that are very easy to recognize than our NACE t-code setup. As we know, NACE t-code is follow  based on our condition technique setup, which it takes the combinations of key index and cross-check the condition record, then the medium things and routine things follow up.

Lets look how can activate the Output Management before NAST

Next step, we can go to Define Output Types




As we can see, for each Object Types, Output Management support not only different ranges of Output Type but also the variance of the Output, which is different approach from NAST.  

Let’s take the Change for example. In NAST, we can retrigger the old output by in case of changes. The same output will be trigger once again when we hit save on the document. But for the Output Management, we could have our own “changes” output here.

Let’s check this output type for “Cash Sales Changes” as below



Double click on the Callback Class.

As we can see just one type of Output, we can see the API information or type of forms/mediums that the output can support in this case

Next step, as we remember from our Friend NAST, in order to generate an output , we need to know which medium (EDI, Printer, Email, Tax).. For each type of output, if you remember, we have this screen in NACE:



For Output Management, we follow BRF+ (Business Rule Framework), so we do not follow Condition Technique.

So it means that for each output type, you have different means of Channel (or Medium if you are in NACE/NAST). Each Output type has their own channel, and each output type has their own form templates or their own email templates. We can check at detail at “Assign Form Template” or ”Assign Email Template”

Enough for the setup, let’s get to the most important part of our Output Management.

instead of Output procedure or condition technique we have to deal with, Output management with the help of BRF+, use the “Business Rules for Output Determination”

As you can see, since its not follow the Condition Technique, Output Management helps user to setup the rule with friendly UI. However, for me Condition Technique is less complex than, because it is used not only for Output but also for Pricing for Sales, Pricing for Purchasing or Tax Determination (just my 2 cents).

Let’s get back to our Business rule:

For Output type, we can input the combinations we like (of course base on the table related to the situations, again, more user-friendly, less consultant-friendly (your pick)

For other’s determination, these can base on the same rule for Receiver, Printer Settings, etc. Just the same as Condition Record, but at more “user-friendly”

After all the setup, get back to how our Output type working in Transactional situation, in this case is the Purchase Order:

As you can see, when we activate the Output Management, the old screen of NAST is no longer, instead, its now generate new type of screen. In this screen, we input PRINT “channel” as our medium in this case. Click on line, choose button ”Display Details”:

Or we can look over if we use “EMAIL” channel, you can easily put CC or BCC for email address

CONCLUSIONS

As we can see how easily that users can access to their output and adjust their output with just simple modifications, even add emails for CC or BCC purposes. However, we also see that how frustration Output Management can bring out whenever if we want to have new type of forms, or any new heavy-customized oriented conditions, while NAST can provide us with just few clicks.  So we surely know that S/4 Hana Output Management could be used in the situations that are more centralized, more " basic" and less "complicated", while our NAST could be trustworthy at all the time, but both of them are solutions to different scenarios so don't just stick to only one. Be flexible within the situation.

entry.title: Re: Able to Schedule Dates on Weekends (Make Parts - MRP...
entry.content:
You’ve nailed your factory calendar, work‐center calendar, and shift sequence—all show capacity on Saturdays and Sundays. To get both production orders and MRP planned orders to actually land on weekends, you must align two additional “date engines” in SAP: the MRP Planning Calendar (for period‐lot sizing) and your order‐scheduling logic (margin keys and OPU parameters).

  • How MRP dates are calculated is that with lot‐for‐lot (EX) or reorder‐point (VB) sizing, MRP uses net‐requirement or reorder‐run dates plus lead times, then applies the Factory Calendar. Since yours is 7-day, EX orders will fall on weekends only if the demand date itself is a weekend.
  • With Period Lot Size (PK), MRP groups requirements into planning‐calendar periods and dates planned orders on the period boundary. This uses a separate Planning Calendar, not the factory calendar.
  • Create a Planning Calendar (SPRO → Production → Material Requirements Planning → Master Data → Define Planning Calendar). Give it an ID (e.g. Z7DAYS), validity covering your horizon. Mark Mon–Sun as working days.
  • Or use transaction MD25 to build Z7DAYS. Calculation rule = Daily (or Weekly with daily periods). Flag every day as working
  • Assign to the Material (MM02 → MRP 2 view). Lot‐size procedure = PK. Planning calendar = Z7DAYS

With this in place, MRP will date planned orders on weekends whenever period boundaries (or net requirements, if EX) fall there.

Your production scheduling engine relies on:

  • Work Center calendar (7-day)
  • Shift sequence (includes weekend shifts)
  • Routing operation durations
  • Scheduling margin key (float before/after)

Check the Scheduling Margin Key in SPRO → Production → Production Scheduling → Scheduling → Maintain Scheduling Margin Keys

Select your key (e.g. “01”). Ensure Floats Before/After are set as needed. No indicator forcing “earliest start = next working day”

Margin keys don’t themselves skip non-working days—they defer to the calendar on your work center. With your WC calendar open on weekends, operations will schedule there.

Finally, OPU3 (planned orders) and OPU5 (production orders) determine forward/backward scheduling logic. Make sure they reference your weekend‐enabled work center and do not override the calendar with fixed‐date flags

entry.title: PCo fundamentals
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I recently started learning PCo and have some basic questions that I haven't been able to find answers to.

My configuration is as follows:
PCo version 15.5.
Source: Socket Source System with multiple connections.
Destination: RFC to ECC.

I have an agent with the SAP NW RFC Server configured (Program ID: PCO_RFC_AGENT) and a notification with an "Always" trigger. On the ECC side, I have a single RFC destination. I am able to receive the message in SAP via the RFC function module S_PCO_RFC_EXECUTE_RECEIVE_EVNT. All notifications are sent with the same application handle PCO_NOTIFY. After XML data extraction I get "1 W01_9311 xsd:string S S -0.23380 kg# None", where W01_9311 is the socket connection name (can be used as an ID) 

The setup for this scenario is well documented, but I still have some fundamental questions:

  1. In my case, socket with multiple connections, each notification must trigger a different function module. How can I achieve this?
  2. When using multiple agents with the same RFC destination, notifications still need to trigger different functions modules. 
  3. Should I manage multiple RFC destinations in SAP (SM59), or is one sufficient with different Program ID?

Any help welcomed!

entry.title: SAPUI5 ui.table checkbox in a column template problem
entry.content:
I am using a CheckBox in Column template in a ui.table in SAPUI5. But when scrolling the table, the CheckBox is frozen in the row, and it does not scroll. How can solve this issue?

I tried creating a Custom Checkbox without using the ui5 Checkbox but also did not work. The example that I posted is from the SDK website using the last version available.

<mvc:View
    controllerName="sap.ui.table.sample.Basic.Controller"
    xmlns="sap.ui.table"
    xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
    xmlns:u="sap.ui.unified"
    xmlns:c="sap.ui.core"
    xmlns:m="sap.m"
    xmlns:p="sap.m.plugins"
    height="100%">
    <m:Page
        showHeader="false"
        enableScrolling="false"
        class="sapUiContentPadding">
        <m:content>
            <Table
                rows="{/ProductCollection}"
                selectionMode="MultiToggle"
                paste="onPaste"
                ariaLabelledBy="title">
                <extension>
                    <m:OverflowToolbar style="Clear">
                        <m:Title id="title" text="Products"/>
                    </m:OverflowToolbar>
                </extension>
                <columns>
                    <Column width="11rem">
                        <m:Label text="Product Name" />
                        <template>
                            <m:Text text="{Name}" wrapping="false" />
                        </template>
                        <dependents>
                            <p:ColumnAIAction press="onAIActionPress"></p:ColumnAIAction>
                        </dependents>
                    </Column>
                    <Column width="11rem">
                        <m:Label text="Product Id" />
                        <template>
                            <m:CheckBox/>
                        </template>
                    </Column>
                </columns>
            </Table>
        </m:content>
    </m:Page>
</mvc:View>

entry.title: Re: In the context of Production Planning Integration, NB...
entry.content:
Hi @thiago-araujo 

Following up on your question about your Production Planning Integration, here is what i think is probably happening and what should check to pinpoint the issue

Based on the information you provided, the issue potential highlights that the system is not correctly assigning order numbers to the planned orders during the integration process. That issue is often caused by either missing or misconfigured number ranges for your order types in S/4HANA.

It is important to note that when the order number is "0000000000," the system treats each new order as the same one, resulting in replacement rather than multiple unique orders that might be the target in this case.

I recommend you try the evaluate the following:

First, make sure to review the configuration for planned order types and make sure that number ranges are correctly defined and available in your S/4HANA backend.

Then, once you have confirmed that the number ranges are set up correctly, run the integration again to confirm that orders are now assigned to the proper numbers and each IBP execution results in unique orders.

Should the problem persist, enable detailed logs or tracing on the PP-DS order creation, and consider reaching out to SAP support with all findings and a reference to your applied SAP notes.

 

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

 

 

Managing Planned Orders in SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Re: Unexpected Behavior with Team Filter in Peform Mainte...
entry.content:
Hi @MarieMor 

Thank you for the details and your hypothesis. I will walk you through my understanding.

Haven evaluated the details provided; I reviewed your question and can share the potential cause of the issues you are facing.

First, note that when you define a team in the type MAINT_TEAM app, this only drives job filtering if there you have directly assigned users as team members to that specific work centre’s team.

Also note that currently there is no automatic link from MAINT_TEAM to HR objects unless you explicitly add the person or their role as a member in the team definition as desired.

Following on that, when HR assignments are made directly to the work center, the jobs appear because those assignments are already recognized in responsibility determination.

Finally, without either personalization or explicit person-to-team assignment, the filter will not return results.

This is what i suggest you should do:

It is important to ensure that each of the intended user is added as a team member in the relevant work center team.

Once that is done, confirm the team is linked to the correct work center.

You do not require any extra HR mapping step but the user must explicitly exist in the team for filtering to work.

The summary is, MAINT_TEAM is not implicitly tied to HR data, and the job filter will work without HR assignments only if the users are directly assigned in the team setup for that work center.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Autosubmission of empty timesheets
entry.content:
Hi @ManonH 

Regarding your question about empty timesheets not being auto submitted when no overtime is recorded, please note that by design, SAP’s Time Sheet Submit job will only process timesheets with recorded entries or generated external time data. If your timesheet is fully empty and untouched, no external data is generated and therefore will be skipped by the job.

Please note, when you edit your desired timesheet and delete entries, this creates external data that triggers submission even if it is empty afterward.

For you to be able to carry out auto submission of untouched empty timesheets, you will need to configure the desired Time Sheet Submission Rules assigned to your overtime recorders that defines this behaviour or you can make use of the Time Recording Calendar to trigger submissions on defined schedules.

Finally, make sure that there are no pending approvals or errors that block submission.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

2738965 - Time Sheet Automatic Submission and Workflow Processing Behavior

Automatic Submission of Time Sheets

entry.title: Re: Integrating 3PL REST API with SAP Public Cloud (1ZQ S...
entry.content:
Hi @mbesli33 

Thank you for your question. Haven read through your details, there are a few key points that I would like to highlight.

Please note that the scope item 1ZQ in the Public Cloud is currently delivered with SOAP-based communication arrangements and message structures which is done via WSDL. It does not have a native mechanism to consume a REST API directly.

Also, SAP’s Public Cloud does not provide any in‑system message transformation or REST↔SOAP protocol mediation. Based on information, this was done by design to ensure and preserve the clean core approach and avoid embedded middleware.

However, note that custom APIs can expose new OData or REST endpoints but they will not transform any existing standard SOAP interfaces for 1ZQ.

Based on those details it is clear that without Integration Suite, your only technical options are to:

First, have the 3PL adapt their interface to expose a SOAP service.

Then to introduce a lightweight external transformation service to handle the REST↔SOAP mapping and field‑level conversions before you call the S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Be aware that any field or structure mapping will need to happen in that external layer or on the 3PL side. There is currently no configuration‑only way in Public Cloud to remap payloads for the standard 1ZQ SOAP service.

That brings me to my recommendation; If avoiding middleware entirely is mandatory for you, the most feasible route is to work with the 3PL to match SAP’s standard SOAP schema. If limited external services are possible, a small cloud-hosted adapter can help you bridge REST and SOAP without a full middleware platform.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

 

Building and Publishing External APIs in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public: From ADT to Postman

entry.title: Re: Image Upload
entry.content:
In the SAP S/4HANA public-cloud Migration Cockpit, the “Document Info Record” migration object relies on the Document Management Service (DMS) that runs in your Cloud Foundry space. If DMS isn’t provisioned and bound, any attempt to upload attachments (images, PDFs, etc.) fails with that error because the cockpit can’t find an active repository to store the files.

If you can provision DMS in CF, that’s the simplest way to get cockpit-based image uploads working. • If you’re on public-cloud edition and DMS is not available, switch to the Fiori attachment apps or OData/REST APIs to attach files. • For bulk uploads, combine a staging-table approach with a custom CF service or SAP Build Process Automation to push images after your migration run.

Pick the path that matches your landscape’s Cloud-Foundry capabilities and your project’s cutover constraints.

entry.title: Re: Handling Late Variant Configuration Changes in Assemb...
entry.content:
Standard SD→PS variant-configuration integration always generates the network via CN01 at sales-order save. That network carries out the dynamic BOM explosion using your class dependencies. If you pre-create a PS network and then merely link the sales-order item to it, SAP skips the VC explosion logic and you lose the dynamic BOM linkage. In the public-cloud edition there’s no out-of-the-box switch to “attach” a VC BOM to an existing network.

To use Non-Valuated Project Stock for long-lead VC Components, in your PS project definition (CJ20N), set the Project Stock Indicator to Non-Valuated Stock. This creates a dedicated stock segment tied to your WBS element that:

  • Holds quantity only (no balance-sheet or WIP valuation)
  • On goods receipt of purchased components, posts the full cost directly to the WBS element (debit), bypassing inventory accounts
  • When you consume stock in the network activity (GI), SAP simply updates the quantity without additional FI postings, because the cost already hit the project at receipt.

How SAP handles dynamic VC Components + Non-Valuated Stock is that Network Creation via SD→PS (CN01) reads your VC class, characteristics, and dependencies to explode the correct variant BOM.

MRP (or the network’s automatic procurement proposals) generates:

  • Planned Orders / PRs for stock items (procurement type ‘F’) into the project’s non-valuated stock segment
  • Direct PRs (non-stock items) on the network activity for external procurement

When GR is posted against those PRs/Purchase Orders, costs are immediately charged to the WBS. There’s no interim stock valuation on the balance sheet; everything flows straight into project costs3.

To answer the question, can you skip the Assembly Network and still use VC BOM in MRP?, No. Standard MRP does not perform variant-specific BOM explosions—only static production BOMs are exploded during MD02. The VC logic is embedded in the CN01/PS-assembly step, not the core MRP run. If you try to run MD02 on a configurable material, SAP will ignore class-based dependencies and only use the base BOM (if any). To leverage variant BOM selection, you must trigger the VC explosion via a network (or custom BAPI) before planning.

entry.title: Re: How to troubleshot /SCWM/STAGE and why it is seeing a...
entry.content:
Hi @Mladen_Milter54 

Thank you for the question.

Not sure this problem still exists on your end. However this is my analysis of the problem and a potential fix.

Regarding the issue where /SCWM/STAGE creates staging tasks for one PMR but not for another despite identical material and apparent stock availability, the root cause typically lies in how the system evaluates stock and staging requests at run time.

To better analyse and understand what the cause might be, I would advice to look into the following:

Make sure to confirm that quantities are populated and status is 'Open'

Ensure to review and use /SCWM/MON --> Production --> Staging --> Staging Requests to verify if the PMR is already fully staged or if it still has open WTs potentially blocking new staging tasks.

Ensure that PSA is correctly assigned and the Control Cycle configurations such as staging method or single- vs cross-order are consistent between PMRs.

Make sure to check source bin stock is available in /SCWM/MON considering batch, stock type, HU, and ensure bins are not locked or blocked in any form.

Also, confirm your PSA bin removal indicators are properly set and make sure your bins are not locked or reserved.

Then enable detailed application logs in /SCWM/STAGE to help you pinpoint filtering or quantity assignment issues that may cause zero quantity staging proposals.

Finally, carry out a test with a fresh PMR to exclude timing or transient stock availability issues.

It is common that the message “All staging proposed quantities are 0 in the staging request” means the EWM found no assignable stock matching the PMR filters at staging time and therefore blocking task creation.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

 

Create EWM Staging Request

Staging of EWM Parts

entry.title: Re: SQL Query – Report for Approval Status and Approval T...
entry.content:
Hi All,

I wanted to share a SQL query that helped us retrieve Purchase Order (PO) approval status along with the details of each approver in the release strategy.

One of my colleagues developed this query, and it turned out to be very useful when analyzing approval workflows and pending release stages.

Select A.EBELN,A.AEDAT,A.ERNAM,A.LIFNR,N.NAME1||' '||N.NAME2 SUPPLIER,A.FRGKE,A.FRGZU,A.FRGSX,A.PROCSTAT,C.FRGCT APP1,D.FRGCT APP2,E.FRGCT APP3,F.FRGCT APP4,G.FRGCT APP5,H.FRGCT APP6,I.FRGET ,
L.FRGCT LASTAPP,O.OBJID,Q.NAME_TEXT,A.WAERS,(Case When A.WAERS='OMR' then M.POVAL/10 else M.POVAL end)*A.WKURS POVAL
from EKKO A Left join T16FS B on (A.FRGSX=B.FRGSX)
Left join T16FD C on (B.FRGC1=C.FRGCO)
Left join T16FD D on (B.FRGC2=D.FRGCO)
Left join T16FD E on (B.FRGC3=E.FRGCO)
Left join T16FD F on (B.FRGC4=F.FRGCO)
Left join T16FD G on (B.FRGC5=G.FRGCO)
left join T16FD H on (B.FRGC6=H.FRGCO)
left join T16FE I on (A.MANDT=I.MANDT and I.SPRAS='E' and A.FRGKE=I.FRGKE)
left join (Select INSTID,MAX(WI_ID) WI_ID from SWW_WI2OBJ J
where WI_RELTYPE='99' and TYPEID='BUS2012'
group by INSTID
) J on (J.INSTID=A.EBELN)
left join SWW_CONT K on (J.WI_ID=K.WI_ID and K.ELEMENT='RELEASECODE')
Left join T16FD L on (K.VALUE=L.FRGCO)
inner join (Select EBELN,Sum(EFFWR) POVAL from EKPO Group by EBELN) M on (A.EBELN=M.EBELN)
inner join LFA1 N on (A.LIFNR=N.LIFNR)
left join T16FW O on (K.VALUE=O.FRGCO)
left join USR21 P on (O.OBJID=P.BNAME)
Left Join ADRP Q on (P.PERSNUMBER=Q.PERSNUMBER)
where BSTYP='F' and BSART='NB'
Order by A.EBELN

entry.title: Re: Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Planning Cost Calculat...
entry.content:
@SANA11 

The code block you highlighted is just creating a debit with equivalent -ve of credit for all amounts and quantity for valid partner costcentres (partner cc !=#). It does this by creating a pairing of the cc and partner cc ( partner cc = CC and CC = patner cc) while doing this assignment.

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Planning Cost Calculat...
entry.content:
In your OPEX allocation script, the block labelled “Calculate Counter item” isn’t about extra billing or a special fee—it’s the mirror‐image posting that balances the sender cost center’s original activity consumption. In Activity‐Based Costing, every time cost center A “sends” 100 hours of machine time to cost center B, two entries must occur:

  • Receiver posting: cost center B picks up 100 hours × rate → debit of €X
  • Counter item: cost center A must credit 100 hours × rate → credit of €X

That counter‐posting is exactly what this code block builds. Without it, your sender would show no reduction in capacity cost, and total system costs wouldn’t balance to zero across all centers.

entry.title: Re: Use of Campaign orders in Process industry - PCA1
entry.content:
From your post, what I could understand the purpose of Campaign Order is that

  • Used to collect overhead costs like cleaning, setup, and changeover.
  • Created without a material to isolate non-product-specific costs.
  • Later, these costs are settled to actual process orders (e.g., ZI01).

You can add process orders and planned orders, even from multiple materials. Campaign scheduling adjusts to cover all included orders. Planned orders added via “Create Planned Order” are included in the campaign window but retain their own MRP scheduling.

Confirming ZI02 (via button or COR6N) records actual labor/machine time. Ensures accurate cost tracking and supports proper settlement.

Costs from ZI02 are transferred to ZI01 using a settlement rule. This can be automated using standard SAP settlement jobs (e.g., KO88).

You can include PM/QM orders if configured in the same order group. Cost collectors are better for continuous overhead tracking, but not campaign-style grouping.

entry.title: Re: Availability Check for Components in Default Storage...
entry.content:
The standard behavior in SAPPP-PI is that SAP typically checks component availability at the storage location assigned in the process order (often the production supply location). If no storage location is specified, the check defaults to plant-level stock. LGFSB is stored in the MRP2 view of the material master and used during purchase requisition creation, not necessarily during availability checks.

So what you can do is assign LGFSB as the Component Storage Location. In your BOM or recipe, assign LGFSB as the default storage location for components. Alternatively, use production version or routing/recipe to specify LGFSB explicitly.

Adjust Availability Check Scope in SPRO → Production → Shop Floor Control → Operations → Availability Check. There Define Scope of Check (transaction OPJJ). Ensure it includes storage location-level stock and not just plant-level. You can exclude the production supply location by setting its MRP indicator to ‘1’ (excluded from MRP and ATP).

Use Checking Control in SPRO → Production → Shop Floor Control → Operations → Availability Check → Define Checking Control. There Set up a checking rule for your order type and plant. Ensure it triggers the check at order release and uses the correct scope.

To override the storage location dynamically during availability check, you can try with BAdI: WORKORDER_UPDATE with which, you can inject LGFSB as the storage location for components before the check runs.

entry.title: Re: Data Action and null

@daniel_weisblut86 

i need a way (script or data action to replace null with 0) -  Never attempt this as this is not advisable and will clog your system with unwanted 0's and create performance issues.

The data action need to calculate Bud 2026 as 
Act 2025 * Measure 1

Measure 1 can be null or 1

Other way of interpreting this is in 2 steps

Bud26= Actual 25 * 0.0  // This will make Actual 25 data as 0 and assign to Bud26

Bud26=Actual25* Measure 1 // Some 0 records from above will be overwritten wherever Measure 1 will exist 

 

Either you can have Measure1 as 1 and 0 explicitly instead of 1 and null or do it in 2 steps as above.

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Easy way to move zeroes in SAP BTP ABAP(Steampunk), JS & Python
entry.content:
Introduction

This is part of the Easy way to write algorithms in ABAP: Series 01. For more algorithms, please check the main blog-post.

Problem

Given an integer array nums, move all 0's to the end of it while maintaining the relative order of the non-zero elements.

Note that you must do this in-place without making a copy of the array.

Example 1:

Input: nums = [0,1,0,3,12]
Output: [1,3,12,0,0]

Example 2:

Input: nums = [0]
Output: [0]

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 104
  • -231 <= nums[i] <= 231 - 1

Follow up: Could you minimize the total number of operations done?

Solution

Time Complexity: O(n)
Space Complexity: O(1)

ABAP

CLASS zmove_zeroes DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC .

  PUBLIC SECTION.
    INTERFACES if_oo_adt_classrun.

  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    " Define a table type for integers
    TYPES ty_nums TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF i WITH EMPTY KEY.

    " Method to move zeroes in-place
    METHODS moveZeroes
      CHANGING lt_nums TYPE ty_nums.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS zmove_zeroes IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD if_oo_adt_classrun~main.
    " Initialize the number array with some zeroes and non-zeroes
    DATA(lt_nums) = VALUE ty_nums( ( 0 ) ( 1 ) ( 0 ) ( 3 ) ( 12 ) ).

    " Output the array before moving zeroes
    out->write( |Array before moving zeroes: | ).
    LOOP AT lt_nums INTO DATA(lv_num).
      out->write( lv_num ).
    ENDLOOP.

    " Call the method to move zeroes to the end
    moveZeroes( CHANGING lt_nums = lt_nums ).

    " Output the array after moving zeroes
    out->write( |Array after moving zeroes: | ).
    LOOP AT lt_nums INTO lv_num.
      out->write( lv_num ).
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD moveZeroes.

    DATA(lv_count) = 0. " Counter for non-zero elements

    " First pass: Move all non-zero elements to the front
    LOOP AT lt_nums ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lf_num>).
      IF <lf_num> <> 0.
        " Place the non-zero element at the next available position
        lt_nums[ lv_count + 1 ] = <lf_num>.
        lv_count += 1.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.

    " Second pass: Fill the rest of the array with zeroes
    WHILE lv_count < lines( lt_nums ).
      lt_nums[ lv_count + 1 ] = 0.
      lv_count += 1.
    ENDWHILE.

  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

JavaScript

function moveZeroes(nums) {
    let left = 0;
    for (let right = 0; right < nums.length; right++) {
        if (nums[right] !== 0) {
            // Swap nums[left] and nums[right]
            let temp = nums[left];
            nums[left] = nums[right];
            nums[right] = temp;
            left++;
        }
    }
    return nums;
}

 

Python

def moveZeroes(nums):
    left = 0
    for right in range(len(nums)):
        if nums[right] != 0:
            nums[left], nums[right] = nums[right], nums[left]
            left += 1
    return nums

 

N.B: For ABAP, I am using SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2309 Release.

Happy Coding! 🙂

entry.title: Re: I want "Display line item in general ledger" report f...
entry.content:
Hello @NidhiKrishna 

In SAP S4 Public cloud, the Display Line Items in General Ledger app (Fiori app ID F2217) lacks a direct send by Email button for report output. However, you can still accomplish this by using one of the following methods below;

Export and send manually

  • Run the report in the Display Line Items in General Ledger app.
  • Use the Export → Spreadsheet / PDF option.
  • Send the exported file via your email client.

Use the Schedule Accounts app for automated output

  • Open the app Schedule General Ledger Jobs or Schedule Jobs F1702
  • Select a job template for Display Line Items in General Ledger or related CDS view query.
  • Set output format to Spreadsheet or PDF.
  • In job parameters, choose Send by Email and specify recipient addresses.
  • Schedule it periodically or as a one-off.

Create a custom report in Custom Analytical Queries

  • CDS view: C_GLLineItemRawData or I_JournalEntryItem.
  • Build a query with the same selection logic as the Display Line Items app.
  • Add the query to View Browser or Analytics.
  • Use Schedule Publication in the Fiori Launchpad to send the results by email automatically.

Let me know if it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: DI API Problem Class COM with SAP Business One Application
entry.content:
Hello !

I share with you the solution found for a problem that i had while creating an application that communiquates with SAP Business One.

The problem (error) was :

While creating a solution for a client, requiring a connection to the SAP system, we encountered the following issue:The app is generated in 64-bit, but if SAP DIAPI 32 is installed, it points to it, resulting in a COM class error. If DIAPI 32 is not installed, the application points to 64 and works normally!
🔹 The application is correctly compiled in 64-bit.
🔹 We want to install the 32-bit DI API (in addition to the 64-bit), which is necessary for launching certain add-ons. However, when it is installed, the app crashes because it automatically connects to the 32-bit DI API instead of the 64-bit one.
👉 Result: COM error (Class not registered, Retrieving the COM class factory failed, etc.) when both versions are installed, even though the app is 64-bit.

 

Please find the solution in the following post : https://www.linkedin.com/posts/tarik-bentayeb-5a81501bb_solution-pour-un-probl%C3%A8me-di-api-sap-b1-activity-7360321854651125760-WAqv?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android&rcm=ACoAADMZ1FAB2YZRL7QaWU7ODUDS4cddMYfS2HE

 

SAP Business One

entry.title: Re: Project Systems, Clear information on BoQs
entry.content:
In SAP there isn't an explicit object called a Bill of Quantities.  The cost estimate (BoQ) for a construction project can be represented in SAP with a PS Project Cost Plan using Network Activities and Components.  You can also use Unit Costing on WBS elements to represent the BoQ.

SAP has an object called a Bill on Materials (BOM) but that is material only.

entry.title: Cloud Integration with Document AI
entry.content:
Introduction:

In this blog post, I will demonstrate how to connect Cloud Integration with Document AI. As a use case, let’s consider a scenario where a hospital registers a new patient, and the patient submits their previous prescription records. Using Document AI, we can extract relevant details such as past illnesses, allergies, and the patient’s blood group.

Document AI:

Step 1. As a pre-requisite, run a booster to activate Document AI in a trial account.  Reference link: Use Trial to Set Up Account for SAP Document AI and Get Service Key

Step 2. Create a custom schema as shown below.

Step 3. Upload sample prescriptions. Here, I have uploaded two prescriptions of a patient (merged into a single PDF). Please note that all the data is fictitious.

Step 4. Verify the extraction results, if required edit and then confirm.

For this example we get confidence percentage is 51%-80%. Please note, instant learning based on feedback is available on premium edition. Reference link: Instant Learning (Premium Edition)

Cloud Integration:

For the demo, I will send the PDF to Cloud Integration using an API testing tool. Cloud Integration will then forward it to Document AI, extract the results. 

The list of Document AI's APIs can be viewed using Swagger UI. The URL for swagger can be constructed from the Service key in the format: <tenantuiurl><swagger>

To call the Document AI API to post documents, use the below API.

The content modifier is used to set the options as below.

The groovy script is used to create the multipart/form-data format. The endpoint for the 1st call is <tenantuiurl><swagger>document/jobs

The response structure of the 1st call is shown below:

Retrieve the id and use the looping processing call option to get the extraction result once the job is completed.

entry.title: Re: Handling Late Variant Configuration Changes in Assemb...
entry.content:
You can assign Configurable Materials as network activity components directly in PS and the configurator will pop-up.

You can use non-valuated project stock components for long lead materials but you have to watch the WBS assignment on the raw materials and the manufactured materials to make sure they are the same otherwise you will get double ordering on the different WBS elements.  With Non-Val stock you will also see big cost variances on the production order since the raw material will post quantity only to the PP order without value.

1.  Is the material maintained as Valuated or Non-Valuated Project Stock?  Check the Project Definition for the stock valuation setting.  If it is Non-Valuated Stock then value movements are manual via a journal entry.  EDIT: you said this is in S/4HANA Public Cloud, correct?  There is no Non-Valuated Project Stock in Public Cloud.

2.  Why Movement Types 343 and 344?  Those are for moving between blocked stock to unrestricted.  I have used 415Q to move from WBS to WBS.

entry.title: Re: Rise issue with Personas flavor authorization
entry.content:
If the flavors work as expected with SAP_ALL authorization profile but are not applied with something else assigned, then it seems pretty clear that the problem is on the authorization side. Without looking in the system, I cannot tell you what exactly causes the issue but that's where I'd look.

The reason for not seeing authorization problems in SU53 is that in runtime mode, we are trying to avoid filling up the authorization log with eventual failed authorization check messages for users who have no Personas access assigned and determine the user's authorizations in an alternate way.

entry.title: Re: Showing wrong attachment document in SAP MM
entry.content:
Hi @pratik_soni6 

Based on your last comments, this issue usually stems from a mapping or linkage problem in the integration chain between Ariba and SAP. I would suggest you proceed doing the following:

First you should confirm uniqueness and correctness of your document IDs and filenames in Ariba, ensure that there is no crossover in references within the outbound payload.

Then, make sure to validate the middleware mapping logic to ensure that the document name references correctly bind correctly to the matching file content without overwrites or mix-ups.

On the SAP side, investigate your attachment storage and linking, check for duplicate content IDs or incorrect metadata linking that may causes the wrong document to appear under a correct filename.

Proceed to perform controlled testing with distinct files and trace the full message payload from Ariba to SAP to pinpoint exactly where the mismatch occurs.

Please note, if you still experience the same problem after these steps, I suggest you engage SAP Support to review payload logs and mapping configurations in depth.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Autosubmission of empty timesheets
entry.content:
Hi @ManonH 

Thank you for your response.

To enable you cover untouched empty timesheets, you will need to create and assign a Time Sheet Submission Rule that explicitly includes criteria to auto-submit timesheets even when empty for your overtime recorders.

Please ensure this rule is linked to your Time Recording Submission Configuration and Time Recording Profile set for overtime recording type.

As mentioned earlier, you also have the option to use the Time Recording Calendar to trigger auto submissions on specific dates, independently of timesheet content.

If your current submission rule does not pick up empty timesheets, adjust it to ensure it explicitly includes those cases.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.content:
We get ABAP dump during FI posting for new Company Code with error message KE549 in CO-PA posting.

ST22 Details

Cancelled Program:  RK2A0010_UPDATE

Application Component: CO-PA-PMS

Long text of error message:
 Diagnosis
     An undefined status has been discovered in the data basis for
     Profitability Analysis (CO-PA). The system cannot continue
     processing.
     Aids in diagnosing the problem:
     DIAG1 = "FBB1"
     DIAG2 = "0010"
     DIAG3 = "AUD"
     DIAG4 = "USD"

 Procedure
     Look in OSS for notes regarding error message KE549. The problem
     may have already be known.
     If you do not find a note, open a problem message in OSS and
     include the following information:
     o   What did you do to get this error? Indicate the transaction
         code, menu steps, or executed program that led to this message.
     o   Indicate all the necessary entries you made on any selections
         screens or dialog boxes that might help reproduce the problem.
     o   Make a note of the values listed above (DIAG1 through DIAG4).
     o   If this message appears in a short dump, specify the system and
         the application server in which you received the dump.

 Technical information about the message:
 Message class....... "KE"
 Number.............. 549
 Variable 1.......... "FBB1"
 Variable 2.......... 0010
 Variable 3.......... "AUD"
 Variable 4.......... "USD"

We found an OSS Note related to this dump - 1746096 - Short Dump with KE549 in CO-PA postings.  This note mentions about Pilot note 2377261.

  • Apply Pilot note 2377261. Please contact SAP Support if you would like to be added to the pilot note.

The Add Data Variable button in SAP Build Apps remains disabled because no Data Resource has been connected yet. entry.title: Re: DI API Problem Class COM with SAP Business One Applic...
entry.content:
Hello @Tarik15 

Thanks for sharing , this COM class registration problem with SAP Business One DI API often happens when both 32-bit and 64-bit versions are installed. The system might bind to the 32-bit library even for 64-bit applications, leading to runtime errors.

Key takeaway: align the DI API bitness with your application, and if both versions are required, manage COM registration or use isolated environments to avoid conflicts.

Let me know if it helps

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Negative Posting on Internal Order After Asset Capita...
entry.content:
Hello @MAZIZ 

This is standard behaviour when an internal order is assigned to an asset master in ECC.

The reason it happens,

  • When you allocate post-acquisition costs directly to an Asset Under Construction (AUC) using an internal order, the CO actuals on that order are updated.
  • During capitalisation, SAP adjusts the AUC to match the final asset value. This process automatically posts a credit (negative entry) on the internal order for the settled amount, which reverses those CO actuals. As a result, the available budget appears to have increased.
  • The idea is that the internal order acts as a temporary accumulation point for costs; once these costs are capitalised, they are removed from the CO.

Optional Best practice

If the internal order is solely for monitoring and should not be refunded on capitalization, do not assign it in the asset master. Instead, record costs through postings to the order directly.

If you need to retain the link, modify CO reports (such as S_ALR_87013019) to exclude settlement transactions with business transaction code KOAO, ensuring they do not distort the data budget.

Use a WBS element in Investment Management for multi-asset projects. It manages partial capitalisation more effectively than internal orders with multiple assets.

G/L Accounts and Cost Elements for Settlement. 

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Innovation Adoption in ERP Systems in Portugal
entry.content:
Current ERP Adoption Landscape in Portugal

1. High ERP Penetration

Portugal stands out as one of the European leaders in ERP adoption. In 2021, 52% of Portuguese companies were already using ERP software — well above the EU average of 40.5%. This places the country second only to Belgium (57%) and ahead of Spain (49%). newoxygen.com

2. Cloud Migration

According to the study “Software de Gestão em Portugal e Tecnologias Digitais em 2021” (newoxygen.com), only around 35% of Portuguese companies host their ERP in the cloud. This adoption rate, however, is significantly above the European Union average of 24% in the same context. This gap highlights Portugal’s willingness to embrace cloud technology faster than most of its EU counterparts, opening the door for next-generation ERP solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

3. Regulatory Drivers

Legal requirements — such as certified invoicing software and QR codes on invoices — have pushed many SMEs to invest in compliant ERP systems. Around 50% of companies are acquiring, upgrading, or considering acquiring ERP systems. 

Innovation in Advanced ERP Solutions

1. Banking Connectivity in Portugal

  • The integration between SAP and banking systems has become more professional: SAP promotes the Multi-Bank Connectivity (MBC) solution to simplify connections to multiple banks (supports SWIFT, EBICS, etc.) and has documentation and use cases for adoption in S/4HANA environments.. SAP+1
  • In Portugal, there are already initiatives and technical presentations showing real cases of innovation in banking connectivity with SAP, implemented by Makevalue (references at local events and in the SAP Portugal community).Comunidade SAP
  • Portuguese banks (e.g., Millennium bcp) provide direct integration channels (APIs / "Direct Channel") and documentation for integration with ERP systems. These capabilities enable SAP customers to develop secure and automatic connections between S/4HANA and local banking services (payments, statements, reconciliation)... millenniumbcp.ptfintable.io
  • Another possibility is the implementation of SIBS APIs, whose connectivity partner certification occurs through its SIBS Lab projects. A successful certification project with SAP already exists, developed by Makevalue (partner SAP build)

2. SAP Adoption and Notable Projects

  • Grow with SAP — A cloud-based ERP solution designed for SMEs, offering sector-specific best practices and continuous updates. Adopted by 440 companies in 80 countries, including ~10 in Portugal. Examples:
    • Casa Mendes Gonçalves adopted SAP S/4HANA Cloud to boost operational agility and real-time data integration.
    • Softinsa (IBM subsidiary) was the first SAP partner in Portugal to implement S/4HANA Cloud internally, modernizing finance, procurement, and operations.
  • Portuguese companies embracing SAP S/4HANA for next-gen business process management include Carris, Lactogal, Lusiaves, and Sogrape.
  • Public sector adoption is notable: Comboios de Portugal and Metropolitano de Lisboa implemented SAP HANA as their digital core, enabling instant insights and real-time analytics.
  • In the Customer Experience space, Rádio Popular adopted SAP C/4HANA for a unified customer view.
  • In Human Capital Management, Grupo Nabeiro and Grupo Pestana implemented SAP SuccessFactors.

3. SAP Partner Ecosystem in Portugal

Portugal hosts a mix of global and local SAP partners, including Inetum, MINSAIT, Seidor, SNP, NTT DATA, valantic (Ábaco), Softinsa/IBM, and multinational consultancies such as Accenture and Deloitte. Several alliances have been announced to accelerate S/4HANA migrations (e.g., Seidor+SNP).

There is no recent public figure for the exact number of SAP partners active in Portugal. However, SAP’s Partner Finder tool can be filtered by country and partner type to produce an accurate list.

Summary Table

Phenomenon

Situation in Portugal

Source

ERP Adoption

High (52% of companies; above EU average)

newoxygen.com

Cloud ERP Usage

In 2021, 35% of Portuguese companies host their ERP in the cloud

Newoxygen.com

SME Adoption

Driven by regulation and digital needs

Octa Code

AI in ERP

Present (Cegid Pulse promoting generative AI)

digitalinside.sapo.pt

Modern Cloud Solutions (e.g., SAP)

Ongoing adoption (Grow with SAP, S/4HANA Cloud)

SAP News Center

The Bottom Line

Portugal has a mature ERP adoption landscape, bolstered by regulatory pressures and digital transformation needs. Innovation is accelerating, particularly in cloud and AI-driven ERP systems. SAP plays a central role, with a solid partner ecosystem (around 50 companies in Portugal) and high-profile migration projects to S/4HANA.

The sectors with the largest SME presence include wholesale/retail, agriculture, accommodation & food services, healthcare & social assistance, and construction. In 2022, 80% of new SAP software contracts in Portugal were with SMEs — underscoring SAP’s strong alignment with the country’s business fabric.

References:

  • SAP News Center – Grow with SAP helps SMEs grow
  • SAP News Center – Casa Mendes Gonçalves adopts Grow with SAP
  • SAP News Center – Softinsa bets on S/4HANA Cloud
  • Eurostat – E-business Integration
  • SAP Portugal Partners
  • Bank Conectivity with SAP
